intro: Psychotria aggregata, commonly known as the "devil's weed" or "coca plant," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant contains alkaloids, including cocaine, which make it significant in both botanical and pharmacological studies. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its psychoactive properties, it has been the subject of extensive research and conservation efforts.
